text:
Content marketers & brand builders: what methods/frameworks do you use to make sure that the content you create is ‘on brand’ + that your team knows what ‘on brand’ means? :slightly_smiling_face: 

Context: at Hotjar, we lacked a unified understanding/definition of our voice, so I came up with a framework to help us all be on the same page. This has proven useful, in that we can challenge each other on the basis of “does this [content piece] fit with the framework?” but I’m open to additional ideas of how to improve/change this approach. 

For reference, this is our current the framework—we aim for content that checks all the 4 boxes:

elements.text: Content marketers & brand builders: what methods/frameworks do you use to make sure that the content you create is ‘on brand’ + that your team knows what ‘on brand’ means?

Context: at Hotjar, we lacked a unified understanding/definition of our voice, so I came up with a framework to help us all be on the same page. This has proven useful, in that we can challenge each other on the basis of “does this [content piece] fit with the framework?” but I’m open to additional ideas of how to improve/change this approach. 

For reference, this is our current the framework—we aim for content that checks all the 4 boxes:

text: This is excellent! I’ve gone with an idea I took from Andy Creatodina. “We produce X content for Y people to give Z benefit”.

elements.text: This is excellent! I’ve gone with an idea I took from Andy Creatodina. “We produce X content for Y people to give Z benefit”.

text: Hey <@U012YJ35BML> follow up question: then does it mean you can use any style, provided you give Z benefit? do you have any additional guidelines in place?

elements.text: Hey
follow up question: then does it mean you can use any style, provided you give Z benefit? do you have any additional guidelines in place?

text: It’s pretty loose. I think the style of content relates to the platform you’re distributing too. Me personally, I add to this by picking and being consistent with the voice.

elements.text: It’s pretty loose. I think the style of content relates to the platform you’re distributing too. Me personally, I add to this by picking and being consistent with the voice.

text: Seems like a big task - my position is: we’re working with a car leasing company that have six different websites (prestige, finance, leasing, servicing, zero deposit leasing, umbrella site).  They’ve been posting content across these sites (700-1000) articles but they’re random and don’t relate to the site they’re on. Option A is: create a proper content direction for each site. Option B: centralise the blog on a seperate domain and send traffic to each respective site depending on the article. For example, Fiat 500 review would sit in a central location and link out to finance site for buying and leasing site for leasing.

elements.text: Seems like a big task - my position is: we’re working with a car leasing company that have six different websites (prestige, finance, leasing, servicing, zero deposit leasing, umbrella site).  They’ve been posting content across these sites (700-1000) articles but they’re random and don’t relate to the site they’re on. Option A is: create a proper content direction for each site. Option B: centralise the blog on a seperate domain and send traffic to each respective site depending on the article. For example, Fiat 500 review would sit in a central location and link out to finance site for buying and leasing site for leasing.

text: I like your framework – simple and easy to remember! I’ve seen some companies do pretty in-depth “content style guides”. I don’t know how useful/successful they are at unifying brand voice across teams, but you can check them out and maybe get some inspiration. MailChimp has theirs online for free viewing: <https://styleguide.mailchimp.com/>

attachments.title: Welcome to the Mailchimp Content Style Guide | Mailchimp Content Style Guide
attachments.text: Guidelines and resources for web writers and editors. Includes: voice and tone, grammar, web style, social media, email newsletters, blog posts, legal content, technical content, accessibility, translation, copyright, and more.
attachments.fallback: Mailchimp: Welcome to the Mailchimp Content Style Guide | Mailchimp Content Style Guide

text: Is the idea that one person can ask another, "is this content expert, actionable, simple, and yours?" and that touches off a debate/discussion of sorts about the content?  Or do you have some kind of empirical/objective evaluation framework (e.g. "actionable" => "posts and assets provide the reader with a next step")?

elements.text: Is the idea that one person can ask another, "is this content expert, actionable, simple, and yours?" and that touches off a debate/discussion of sorts about the content?  Or do you have some kind of empirical/objective evaluation framework (e.g. "actionable" => "posts and assets provide the reader with a next step")?

text: It’s kind of both, <@U017XD7H4P7> → for example, we aim for blog content to follow this framework so if it turns out not to be actionable enough (for example, as you said: lack of next steps, lack of instructions, hinting at things w/out going into depth), we send it back to the writer

elements.text: It’s kind of both,

→ for example, we aim for blog content to follow this framework so if it turns out not to be actionable enough (for example, as you said: lack of next steps, lack of instructions, hinting at things w/out going into depth), we send it back to the writer

text: I’m a fan of the contributor guides <@UJE5LQ2JC> puts together - super clear about what the brand is and what they’re interested in publishing, while still leaving room for the contributor to bring their unique style and perspective to the project. <https://docs.google.com/document/d/11Ue4M6wd1jjQNDFEckVIs9d4F17zoCiregqUwB6oPks/edit>

text:
Yes! So our most popular tier is that middle $10 tier which gets them 2 bonus episodes per month (they get to suggest and vote on the bonus episode topics) and then access to our Discord community for other listeners and TS fans.

Our $20 tier is just a joke right now in that it's "For Taylor Swift only" but we're hoping to grow into offering something real there to see if people will switch from $10 to $20.

elements.text:
Yes! So our most popular tier is that middle $10 tier which gets them 2 bonus episodes per month (they get to suggest and vote on the bonus episode topics) and then access to our Discord community for other listeners and TS fans.

Our $20 tier is just a joke right now in that it's "For Taylor Swift only" but we're hoping to grow into offering something real there to see if people will switch from $10 to $20.

text: Still TBD on whether I’m attending but I would like to send a team member to Brandweek 2020. We went in-person last year and it was fantastic. Not content-specific but more brand marketing and a range of content, communications and ad expertise. Adweek does a fantastic job of curating speakers and delivering high quality content…and it is SO much cheaper virtually compared to in-person, especially since as a SaaS company we are considered a “vendor” and have to pay a higher rate.

text: Hey everybody! How many of you rely on video content in your marketing strategy? If yes, what’s your workflow look like right now to produce it? And also, what are your biggest challenges when it comes to creating video?

elements.text: Hey everybody! How many of you rely on video content in your marketing strategy? If yes, what’s your workflow look like right now to produce it? And also, what are your biggest challenges when it comes to creating video?

text: Biggest challenge: Maintaining the content library. Our videos feature product UI and it changes all. the. time.

elements.text: Biggest challenge: Maintaining the content library. Our videos feature product UI and it changes all. the. time.

text: Just started doing this TODAY for some of my own stuff. The time it takes to create and then edit a video on top of already writing the article is quite a bit. I'm hoping that over time, my process becomes more refined and I can do it more quickly.
